intro: Homalium whitmeeanum, commonly known as the whiteflowered homalium, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow-green flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical regions.
